docs.snippet: During an 11-year stretch, through 2013, the A.L. East produced two playoff teams in every season except 2006. Now, the weakness of the division is the primary factor giving hope to all five of its teams....
docs.lead_paragraph: During an 11-year stretch, through 2013, the A.L. East produced two playoff teams in every season except 2006. Now, the weakness of the division is the primary factor giving hope to all five of its teams.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that the American League East is wide-open for contention following 11-year stretch in which it produced two playoff teams in every season except 2006; holds that current weakness of division means that teams like the Tampa Bay Rays and New York Yankees have a real shot at playoffs despite middling records.

headline.main: In Once-Mighty A.L. East, Everyone Can Dream
headline.print_headline: In Once-Mighty A.L. East, Everyone Can Dream

docs.snippet: It's not the TV shows "Homicide" and "The Wire" that come to mind when I think of Baltimore, though both offered an intense look at an American city's poverty, drugs and gangs. Baltimore's glitzy Inner Harbor didn't draw me there either. Instead, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: It's not the TV shows "Homicide" and "The Wire" that come to mind when I think of Baltimore, though both offered an intense look at an American city's poverty, drugs and gangs. Baltimore's glitzy Inner Harbor didn't draw me there either. Instead, I went looking for old things connected to the city's history and quirky local culture — everything from Edgar Allan Poe to row houses and painted window screens, a utilitarian folk art that's being revived. Here's what I found.

headline.main: Baltimore: Poe, Painted Screens, Vintage Treasures
headline.print_headline: Baltimore: Poe, Painted Screens, Vintage Treasures
